notes: SUMMARY: "She was only a 37-millimetre tank buster, manned by fellows from Brooklyn, Louisiana, Illinois and Pennsylvania, but she spoke a big piece in Europe! I. The Story of a Gun. k. Tank Busters. k. [Each place (5)]. k. Guns. Call no.: PN6728.1.N4R4no.23

28.title: Brooklyn
28.author: written by Samuel R
28.series: New York, N.Y.) Bread & Wine : an Erotic Tale of New York
28.appears_in: Delany ; drawn by Mia Wolff ; introduced by Alan Moore.
notes: "This story of life in New York City begins with a chance meeting between a bearded, black professor, Samuel Delany, and a homeless Brooklyn Irishman selling books from a blanket on 72nd Street, and tells how their lives intersect and change forever. Bread & Wine is a beautifully drawn graphic novel about the beginning of a moving and lasting gay relationship, with all the complexities, fumblings and excitement of two people coming together. These men discover sexual joy and explode stereotypes while exploring the possibilities for compassion and acceptance, all the more touching because it's true"
cover blurb.

136.title: Broom-Hilda
136.author: Russell Myers.
136.series: Nov. 6, 1973) "If I Were You, I'd Cut Down on Calcium"
notes: Summary: A golf ball hits Irwin on the head while he's standing under a bird in a nest.

137.title: Broom-Hilda
137.author: by R
137.series: Oct. 6, 1983) "Depends on What You Call Luck"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda is fishing, and gets snagged and dragged away by a man going under the bridge in a boat with his outboard motor. Any luck?

138.title: Broom-Hilda
138.author: by Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda tries to get Wolfie to fetch a duck, and Wolfie brings the duck bandaged in a wheelchair.

139.title: Broom-Hilda
139.author: by R
notes: Summary: Gaylord reminds Broom-Hilda of her promise to cut the grass, so she plucks one blade.

140.title: Broom-Hilda
140.author: by Russel Myers.
140.series: May 16, 1985) "We Can Use a Handicap System!"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda at first refuses to play tennis with Gaylord, but then agrees after removing all but one string from his racket.

141.title: Broom-Hilda
141.author: by Russell Myers.
141.series: Jan. 10, 1986) "Next Time Don't Make It Out of Bathroom Tissue"*
notes: Summary: Irwin has made himself a turban to look sinister and mysterious, but it doesn't work in the rain.

142.title: Broom-Hilda
142.author: Russell Myers.
142.series: Jan. 17, 1986) "One Tummy Scoot for One Crunchy Yummy, a Fair Trade Any Day"*
notes: Summary: Wolfie the dog lets Broom-Hilda be the boss.

143.title: Broom-Hilda
143.author: Russell Myers.
143.series: Sept. 1, 1986) "This Particular Model has the Tina Turner Mimic Option"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda demonstrates her new personal robot.

144.title: Broom-Hilda
144.author: Russell Myers.
144.series: Jan. 21, 1987) "The First Atomic Bomb Was Tested in This Valley over 30 Years Ago with No Lasting Effect on the Environment"
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda is having a picnic on a large dragon-like animal without knowing it.

145.title: Broom-Hilda
145.author: Russell Myers.
145.series: Feb. 25, 1987) "I'm Putting You On the Clothesline for Punishment"*
notes: Summary: Wolfie has been bad, so she hangs him up.

146.title: Broom-Hilda
146.author: Russell Myers.
146.series: Dec. 2, 1987) "Able-Bodied People Who Park in Handicapped Spaces Make Me a Tad Grumpy"*
notes: Summary: Irwin stops to overturn a car in the parking lot.

147.title: Broom-Hilda
147.author: Russell Myers.
147.series: Jan. 16, 1988) "He'd Better Have a Good Excuse"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda's werewolf date is late, and we see him going by in the back of an animal control truck.

148.title: Broom-Hilda
148.author: Russell Myers.
148.series: Jan. 23, 1988) "Oh, Good, You've All Found Your Assigned Places!"*
notes: Summary: At a formal dinner, all the place settings look alike except for Broom-Hilda's, which has a heaping bowl labelled "Rover."

149.title: Broom-Hilda
149.author: Russell Myers.
149.series: Apr. 16, 1988) "An Unusually Pesky Year for Deer!"*
notes: Summary: Irwin's building a fence, while behind him the deer have dynamite and a bulldozer.

150.title: Broom-Hilda
150.author: Russell Myers.
150.series: Apr. 29, 1988) "A Visit from the Denture Fairy"
notes: Key words: Tooth fairy, money, pillows.

151.title: Broom-Hilda
151.author: Russell Myers.
151.series: May 7, 1988) "You Sat There on that Old Hay Baler and Never Said a Word When I Returned That Money?"*

152.title: Broom-Hilda
152.author: by Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Irwin reads a fairy tale to his dad, but updates it so it won't be boring.
Key words: Congress, tax brackets, denture adhesive, wine spritzer, NFL football.

153.title: Broom-Hilda
153.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Flying by on her broom, Broom-Hilda sees several small aircraft including one made from a riding lawnmower.

154.title: Broom-Hilda
154.author: Russell Myers.
154.series: Dec. 28, 1988) "I Wonder What the Soup of the Day Is?"*
notes: Summary: There's a turtle's head sticking up out of Broom-Hilda's soup.

155.title: Broom-Hilda
155.author: Russell Myers.
155.series: Jan. 6, 1989) "Why Do You 'Spose She Was So Insistent We Fasten Our Seat Belts?"*
notes: Summary: The conquered aliens want reparations, and Broom-Hilda prepares to send them back to Xorf with her golf club.

156.title: Broom-Hilda
156.author: Russell Myers.
156.series: May 29, 1990) "Cecilia, Point the Pit Bull at the Front Door and Give Him a Whack!"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda the census taker gets a little too familiar with her questions.

157.title: Broom-Hilda
157.author: Russell Myers.
157.series: May 30, 1990) "Guys, I'm Going to Need Those Forms Back"*
notes: Summary: Irwin the census taker has counted three million for the day because he found an ant colony. He didn't realize it was only for humans.

158.title: Broom-Hilda
158.author: Russell Myers.
158.series: May 31, 1990) "None of Us is Actually What You'd Call Living"*
notes: Summary: Working for the census, Broom-Hilda asks how many people live there. Answer: his wife, 12 kids, both mothers, her brother, his uncle and his uncle's girlfriend and a Rottweiler, in a 2-bedroom house.

159.title: Broom-Hilda
159.author: Russell Myers.
159.series: July 6, 1990) "Why Don't You Hold Your Congratulations 'til she Finishes Chewing up her Golf Ball"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda controls her temper, and doesn't destroy her club.

160.title: Broom-Hilda
160.author: Russell Myers.
160.series: Dec. 14, 1990) "Golf, Tennis and Bowling All In One Day!"*

161.title: Broom-Hilda
161.author: Russell Myers
161.appears_in: reproduced on p. 139 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Gaylord describes golf to Broom-Hilda: you hit the ball into 18 holes and then you go into the bar.

163.title: Broom-Hilda
163.author: Russell Myers.
163.series: May 23, 1991) "You Can Have a Ton of Fun Without Ever Hitting the Ball!"*
notes: Summary: Irwin enjoys watching Broom-Hilda try to play golf.

164.title: Broom-Hilda
164.author: Russell Myers.
164.series: May 24, 1991) "It's a big Advantage When You Think High Score Wins"*
notes: Summary: Irwin doesn't get frustrated by golf.

165.title: Broom-Hilda
165.author: Russell Myers.
165.series: June 5, 1991) "You Realize This Does Nothing to Improve Intergalactic Relations!"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda uses bird seed to lure bird-like aliens into a cage from their flying saucer.

166.title: Broom-Hilda
166.author: Russell Myers.
166.series: Sept. 21, 1991) "Now There's a Date that's Going to End Early"*
notes: Summary: At the restaurant, Broom-Hilda's date has her balancing a dog biscuit on her nose until he says "Eat!"

167.title: Broom-Hilda
167.author: by Russell Myers.
167.series: Oct. 5, 1991) "A Sign of Severe Emotional Trauma"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda appears to be sucking her thumb, but actually she's out of denture adhesive.

168.title: Broom-Hilda
168.author: Russell Myers.
168.series: June 27, 1992) "I'll Just Sit This One Out"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda and a truck driver are fighting over his pasta truck, and Gaylord decides not to get involved.

169.title: Broom-Hilda
169.author: Russell Myers.
169.series: Dec. 15, 1992) "Maybe I'll Just Get a Dog Named Prince"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda is about to kiss a frog, when he goes into an oral hygiene lecture.
Key words: Toothbrushes, dental floss, water pics, mouthwash, lily pads.

170.title: Broom-Hilda
170.author: Russell Myers.
170.series: Jan. 2, 1993) "Holding a Parking Place for My Wife"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda misunderstands why a man is standing in the street, and gets herself run over.

171.title: Broom-Hilda
171.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda zaps Irwin when he tries to wake her, so that it takes him a little time to try again.

172.title: Broom-Hilda
172.author: Russell Myers.
172.series: May 25, 1993) "Next Winter I'm Gonna Have to Store This Thing Indoors"*
notes: Summary: Various animals have been living in Broom-Hilda's lawnmower.

173.title: Broom-Hilda
173.author: Russell Myers.
173.series: June 11, 1993) "Yesterday I Made Too Much Wallpaper Paste"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda serves leftovers.

174.title: Broom-Hilda
174.author: Russell Myers.
174.series: Aug. 27, 1993) "Explosions of Flavor in Your Mouth"*
notes: Summary: Irwin says the chewing gum is designed for younger folks: Broom-Hilda's false teeth fly out.
Key words: Cigars, propeller beanies.

175.title: Broom-Hilda
175.author: Russell Myers.
175.series: Oct. 7, 1993) "It's Not Easy to Cure What I Have"*
notes: Summary: Nerwin is in love with the school nurse.

176.title: Broom-Hilda
176.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda floats across the water hazard on her golf bag.

177.title: Broom-Hilda
177.author: Russell Myers.
177.series: July 28, 1997) "I Can Quit Any Time, but not Today"*
notes: Key words: Eating, pizza, candy bars, pie, addiction.

178.title: Broom-Hilda
178.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda can't stop eating; her tummy's bigger than her brain.
Key word: Stomachs. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Mind Control"

179.title: Broom-Hilda
179.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda still can't stop eating.

180.title: Broom-Hilda
180.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda's hands are bound and she's tied to her chair, but she's still eating.
Key words: Refrigerators, bondage.

181.title: Broom-Hilda
181.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Maybe if we had 600 channels.
Key words: Happiness, couches, television.

182.title: Broom-Hilda
182.author: Russell Myers.
182.series: Aug. 2, 1997) "She'll Consider Paying Them, At Least"*
notes: Summary: Gaylord has a system of same day bill-paying, that Broom-Hilda should adopt.

183.title: Broom-Hilda
183.author: Russell Myers.
183.series: Jan. 15, 1998) "Knowing Magic Sure Helps the Old Backside"*
notes: Summary: A banana peel gag ends in levitation.

184.title: Broom-Hilda
184.author: Russell Myers.
184.series: Feb. 3, 1998) "I Thought It Was A Mirror"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda is grossed out by what she sees in the pet store window; Irwin tells her it's a Shar-Pei.

185.title: Broom-Hilda
185.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda and Irwin are alone in a football stadium, and she's getting ready to give him a carpetshock.

186.title: Broom-Hilda
186.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda thinks she's being whistled at, but actually the man is calling his dog.

187.title: Broom-Hilda
187.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda has no sooner pacified her credit cards, when someone hits her with a baseball bat.
